00050 enum {
00051     SETJMP_DFLT_RET_VAL         =  1,                   
00052     CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID           =  0,                   
00053     CR_SYSTEM_STARTED           = -1,                   
00054     CR_INVALID_ID               = -1,                   
00055     CR_THREAD_CNT_INIT          = -1                    
00056 };

00063 typedef int32_t volatile  cr_id_t;

00071 typedef struct CR_CONTEXT {
00072     void        ( *pFunc )( void );
00073     jmp_buf     env;
00074     cr_id_t     id;
00075 } CR_CONTEXT;
00076 
00090 #define CR_THREAD_INIT( )                                               \
00091             static fenv_t envp;                                         \
00092             static cr_id_t this_id__;                                   \
00093             this_id__ = cr_g_current_cr_id;                             \
00094             if ( !setjmp( cr_g_context[ this_id__ ].env ) ) {           \
00095                 fegetenv( &envp );                                      \
00096                 longjmp( cr_g_reg_func_env, SETJMP_DFLT_RET_VAL );      \
00097             } else { fesetenv( &envp ); }
00098 
00108 #define CR_START( func_name )                                                                                           \
00109             cr_g_previous_cr_id = CR_INVALID_ID;                                                                        \
00110             cr_g_current_cr_id = cr_get_id( func_name );                                                                \
00111             assert( ( cr_g_current_cr_id != CR_INVALID_ID ) && "CR_START:  CR_INVALID_ID!\n" );                         \
00112             assert( ( ( uint32_t ) cr_g_current_cr_id < cr_g_context_cnt ) && "CR_START: ID out of bounds!\n" );        \
00113             cr_g_sys_started = CR_SYSTEM_STARTED;                                                                       \
00114             longjmp( cr_g_context[ cr_g_current_cr_id ].env, SETJMP_DFLT_RET_VAL )
00115 
00124 #define CR_YIELD( func_name )                                                                                   \
00125             cr_g_current_cr_id = cr_get_id( func_name );                                                        \
00126             assert( ( cr_g_current_cr_id != CR_INVALID_ID ) && "CR_YIELD: CR_INVALID_ID!\n" );                  \
00127             assert( ( ( uint32_t ) cr_g_current_cr_id < cr_g_context_cnt) && "CR_YIELD: ID out of bounds!\n" ); \
00128             assert( ( cr_g_current_cr_id != this_id__ ) && "CR_YIELD: recursive coroutine call!\n" );           \
00129             cr_g_previous_cr_id = this_id__;                                                                    \
00130             if ( !setjmp( cr_g_context[ this_id__ ].env ) ) {                                                   \
00131                 fegetenv( &envp );                                                                              \
00132                 longjmp( cr_g_context[ cr_g_current_cr_id ].env, SETJMP_DFLT_RET_VAL );                         \
00133             } else { fesetenv( &envp ); }

00141     /* Should _not_ be modified by the user. They're defined as extern because they're used in the macros. */
00142     extern CR_CONTEXT*  cr_g_context;
00143     extern uint32_t     cr_g_context_cnt;
00144     extern int32_t      cr_g_sys_started;
00145     extern cr_id_t      cr_g_previous_cr_id;
00146     extern cr_id_t      cr_g_current_cr_id;
00147     extern jmp_buf      cr_g_reg_func_env;
00148 
00149     /* Can be modified by the user. */
00150     extern cr_id_t      cr_g_activate_id;
00151 
00152     /* User callable functions. */
00153     extern void         cr_reset( void );
00154     extern void         cr_init( CR_CONTEXT* cr_context, size_t cr_context_count );

00156     extern void         cr_idle( void );
